Geimer by Jack Alice Brunton Bud Sharon Miller Ramon Villamil Genevieve Lohmuller Dolores Borton Gloria Gordon Becky Biberstein Den nis Heyne Fern Britton James Yonker Sr Priscilla Rogers Evelyn Morrissey Betty Meyer Ron Payne David Carr Larry Dustman Ronnie Bonnie Burns Gary Cook Michael Green and George Bitzer 2ND SUNDAY OF EASTER APRIL 23 2017 From the Pastors desk WE ALL ARE INVITED TO REJOICE IN THE LORD AND LIVE LIFE OF FAITH FELOWSHIP AND LOVE My dear brothers and sisters in Christ in the name of the Lord Jesus I say peace with you all These adages are always true with respect to some situations Birds of the same feather flock together birds of a feather flock together Tell me with whom you go and I will tell you the kindtype of person you are Flocking together gives them protection You cannot break a bundle of broom all together a once But if you take the brooms one by one you break each of them We need one another in Fellowship NOT FOLLOWSHIP Listen to this story Once upon a time a hen took her chicks out for feeding All of a sudden a terrible thunder storm stared with a horrible wind and heavy rain fall The hen quickly asked her chicks to come up to high land and spread her wings and the chicks put their heads under the mothers wings After the rain she led them home safely Within few days the mother hen fell sick and died The chicks became hungry after staying for few days without enough food They decided to go out and feed themselves So they went out As they were feeding suddenly a terrible thunderstorm stared with a horrible wind and heavy rain fall The checks were in trouble and frightened One of them said let us hurry home Another said no the flood will carry us away Come up to a high land They hurried up to the high land The leader raised its right wing and asked one of them to put her head under his wing and then closed it and asked his sister chick to raise her wing and her bother chick puts his head So they continue to do forming a circle until the last of ninth chicks raised his wing and the leader put his head By so doing they protected one another and survived the adverse weather We are call to do likewise for one another We are our brothers and sisters keeper That is the fellowship we need to practice In the 1st Reading Acts 24247 We saw the fellowship the communal life of the early Christians of Jerusalem It is called koinonia which means fellowship commun ion brotherhood This is an important element in our Christian way of life Christians of all ages They devoted themselves to the teaching of the apostles and communal life to the breaking of bread and prayers All who believed were together and had all things in common Every day they devoted themselves to meeting together in the temple area They ate their meals with exaltation and sincerity of heart praising God and enjoying favor with all the peoples We need to emulate them by practicing Christian values of love justice tempered with mercy mutual respect decency read the Bible in our family Members should carry one another have concern for each other such fellowship keeps faith alive For those who love God everything works onto good The absence of Thomas when the Lord came became a bless to us In the Gospel Jn 201931 The doors and windows where the apostles were were locked for the fear of the Jews The Lord with His glori fied body stood in their mist and said Peace be with you Thomas was not present week later He came again and Thomas was there He confronted Thomas for his con tinuing doubt Put your finger here and see my hands and bring your hand and put it into my side and do not be unbelieving but believe Thomas exclaimed My Lord and my God Thomas was the first of the apostles to call Jesus God That is great The Lord then said Have you come to believe because you have seen me Blessed are those who have not seen and have believed That is you all of us Let us rejoice in the Lord for He has risen God bless you Msgr Pius Ilechukwu Ever wondered what the New Evangelization is all about The phrase was first coined by St John Paul II in 1979 when he visited Poland and proclaimed New Evangelization has begun even if in reality is is the same as ever You can learn more about YOUR role in the movement by participating in the New Evangelization Summit May 1213 Register today wwwnew evangelizationca The amount needed each week to make budget is 511640 We are 82889 ahead of budget from last week Other Collections within our Parish St Vincent de Paul Fund 35000 Bolivian Mission 19000 Diocesan Special Collection Holy Land 67300 Collection for Weekend of April 1516 2017 Adult Envelopes 364100 Child Envelopes 2979 Loose 47750 Religious Ed Fund 49400 RepairRainy Day Fund 0 Easter Offering 120300 Kobryn Funeral Party at Wells Comm Pool all are invited and welcome ALL DAY ADORATION EXPOSITION OF THE BLESSED SACRAMENT AT ST JOSEPH BLUFFTON Thursday May 4 2017 830am 7:00pm Evening Prayer 6:30pm Litany of the Eucharist Benediction 6:45pm Mass 7:00pm Please sign up on the sheet in the narthex if you plan to come and spend an hour with Jesus in the Blessed Sacra ment This helps us plan the day making sure Jesus is not left alone while exposed on the altar Thank you Bishop Luers to host Run With the Knights 10K Run 5K RunWalk on May 13 FORT WAYNE Indiana Bishop Lu ers High School will host the 10th An nual Run With the Knights 10K Run or 5K RunWalk on Saturday May 13 at 9am at Pavilion 1 at Foster Park The entry fee is 20 per person and online registration is avail able at www.runrace.net search Bishop Luers Run With the Knights Visit www.bishopluers.org and link to the news item in the Latest News to download a race form and map Register by May 3 for a guaranteed Tshirt Contact Tess Steffen at (260)456-1261 Ext 3039 or email at tsteffenbishopluers.org SCRIPTUREMASS READINGS FOR THE WEEK Mon April 24St Fidelis of Sigmaringen Priest and Martyr Acts 42331 Jn 318 Tues April 25St Mark Evangelist 1 Pt 55b14 Mk 161520 Wed April 26 Acts 51726 Jn 31621 Thurs April 27 Acts 52733 Jn 33136 Fri April 28St Peter Chanel Priest and Martyr St Louis Grignion de Montfort Priest Acts 53442 Jn 6115 Sat April 29St Catherine of Siena Virgin and Doctor of the Church Acts 617 Jn 61621 Sun April 30 Third Sunday of Easter Acts 2142233 1 Pt 117 21 Lk 241335 May 13th Mass Observing the 100th Anniversary of the Apparitions of Our Lady of Fatima The Diocese of Fort WayneSouth Bend together with the World Apostolate of Fatima is observing the 100th anniversary of the Marian apparitions at Fatima with an 8:00AM Mass on Saturday May 13 at St John the Baptist Church in Fort Wayne 4500 Fairfield Avenue The centennial Mass will be celebrated by Bishop Kevin Rhoades and all the faithful of the diocese are invited to attend this special liturgy In addition the New Evangelization Summit will be taking place at St John the Baptist the evening before on May 12 and also throughout the day on May 13 after the centennial Mass All are also invited to register for this unique event which will feature talks broadcasted live by Bishop Robert Barron and others Registration and other information can be found at httpswwwnewevangelizationca JERUSALEM CHRISTIAN FAMILIES LAND OF PEACE Will be visiting St Josephs the weekend of May 6 and 7 Land of Peace is a nonprofit organization with the mission of helping and supporting Christian families in the Holy Land through the Patriarch of Jerusalem When anyone purchases handmade arts they help our mission and help the Christians in the Holy Land In 1920 the Christian population in the Holy Land was 80 today it is less than 2 With the parish support and the pa rishioners generosity we are able to help our brothers and sisters to live in Jesus land of birth Redeemer Radio Donate and Listen to Spring Sharathon April 2428 1063FM RedeemerRadiocomdonate
